intro: Dodecatheon triflorum, commonly known as the three-flowered glory-of-the-snow, is a herbaceous perennial native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and produces showy, clustered blooms in early spring. Its leaves are oval and slightly hairy, and it is known for its ability to thrive in partial shade. Dodecatheon triflorum is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to pollinators.
